name: Dawn Core
terse: Improve your survivability by replacing your reactor with an Dawncore drive

ranks.name: Dawncore Tier 1
ranks.description:
• Dangerous Efficiency: The Dawn Core performs best when on the edge. Gain +1 Accuracy on one attack roll per round while you are in the danger zone (above half your Heat Cap).
  • Critical Heat Cap: You gain +2 Heat Cap.

ranks.name: Dawncore Tier 2
ranks.description:
• Thermal Surge: While in the danger zone, the Dawn Core channels excess Heat into your systems. Gain +1 Accuracy on one more attack roll per round.
  • Heat Sink Overclock: When you start your turn in the danger zone, clear 1 Heat at the end of your turn.

ranks.name: Dawncore Tier 3
ranks.description:
• Radiant Overload: While in the danger zone, all of your attacks deal +2 bonus damage.
  • Emergency Stabilizer: Once per scene, if you would overheat, you can immediately clear 4 Heat and avoid the overheat, but your mech becomes Exposed until the end of your next turn.

name: Lucky Bastard
terse: Is luck a talent? some say it is. Luck helps you with surviving on the field or making impossible shots.
description: Some pilots seem to be blessed by fate, always dodging incoming fire by the skin of their teeth or landing improbable hits when it matters most. Whether by instinct or sheer dumb luck, the Lucky Bastard always seems to survive.

ranks.name: Lucky Clover
ranks.description: <ul><li>Fortune’s Favor: Twice per mission, you can force reroll on an enemy attack roll against you. The enemy must use the new result.

ranks.name: Good Karma
ranks.description:
• Lucky Strike: When you roll a natural 20 on an Attack Roll, you can add +1 Difficulty to your target's next attack until the end of their next turn.
  • Narrow Escape: Once per scene, when you are hit by an attack, you may roll a 1d6. On a 5-6, you halve the damage taken.

ranks.name: Lady Luck's first born
ranks.description:
• Impossible Dodge: Once per scene, when an attack would hit you, you may roll a 1d6. On a 4-6, you automatically dodge the attack, taking no damage or effects. On a 1-3, you take the hit but only take half damage.
  • Blessing of the Dice: Once per scene, you can turn any natural roll of 1 into a 20 on an Attack Roll or Dodge Roll. You are then “Cursed” and cannot roll a natural 20 for the rest of the scene.

name: Cyborg
terse: Becoming closer with your mech has never becomes easier as you are connected in more ways than one.
description: Some mechanics claim they can talk to their machines - but you take it literally. more than just cosmetic changes your augments mean your mech is like an extention of your body. was it a back-ally surgeon or a blacksite engineer? did you pay in manna or blood? was it your decision or someone else's? either way there is no going back now.

ranks.name: Neural Link
ranks.description: When a hostile character attacks you as a reaction on your turn roll a 1d6. On a 4+ the attack misses.

ranks.name: Volition Override
ranks.description: When your mech is Stunned or Jammed you may still move up to half of your speed as a standard move and take one quick action. All actions, saves, have a +2 difficulty and cause you to take 1 Heat.

ranks.name: Full Cerebral Sync
ranks.description: When your mech is destroyed you may choose to keep it active though sheer force of will. You are instead recuded to 1 HP. You can not recover or lose HP while this effect is active. At the end of each of your turns whenever you take damage roll 1d20+Grit. on a 10+ your mech remains active otherwise it is immediately destroyed. at the end of each of your turns while this ability is active you gain +1 cumulative difficulty on subsequent rolls. You may only use this ability once per full repair.

name: Bruiser
terse: Hit harder with melee attacks by opening yourself up to reprisal
description: Look, it's simple; you have a mech, your mech has a hammer, and the whole world is made of nails. Now all you need to do is hit someone as hard as you can. If they're still moving afterwards? You hit'em again. And maybe a third time for good measure. All the fancy footwork in the world won't help you when both your legs are broken.

ranks.name: Reckless Swing
ranks.description: 1/round you may choose to gain +1 Accuracy on an attack with a melee weapon on your turn. Until the start of your next turn, the next attack made against you gains +1 Accuracy.

ranks.name: Payback
ranks.description: When you take structure damage, your next melee attack deals +1d6 bonus damage on hit.

ranks.name: Take Your Best Shot
ranks.description: 1/scene as a free action, you may choose a hostile character within line of sight to immediately make an attack against you. That character must be able to attack you, or they cannot be chosen. Afterwards, whether this attack hits or misses, you may make an attack against them with a non-Superheavy melee weapon. You may then allow that character to make another attack against you if they wish, repeating this process until one of you has been destroyed or until they decline to attack you any further.

name: Guerrilla
terse: Use hit-and-run tactics to strike from Hiding and enhance your defense
description: War isn't fair, so why shouldn't you fight the same way? Leave notions of honorable combat to the would-be knights and champions, you're here to get work done. In the shadows, in the split-second flash of lightning before the thunder comes, hit and run, strike and fade. They may hate you, but they'll learn to fear you all the same.

ranks.name: Fighting Ghosts
ranks.description: You may Boost without losing Hidden, and whenever you Disengage attacks against you are made at +1 Difficulty until the end of your next turn.

ranks.name: Go to Ground
ranks.description: If you end your turn in cover which you did not begin your turn in, all ranged attacks against you receive +1 Difficulty until the end of your next turn.

ranks.name: Run and Gun
ranks.description: At the beginning of each scene, before anyone acts you may move up to your speed. If you end this movement in cover, you automatically become Hidden, and until the end of your next turn the first attack roll you make while Hidden gains +1 Accuracy.
